airtrafficcontrol.app.appforconsole

Class ConsoleInputHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • airtrafficcontrol.app.appforconsole.ConsoleInputHandler

  • public class ConsoleInputHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    The instances of this class treat data received from console.

    Implementation notes

    • Methods are static so that one can use them without having to create an instance of type ConsoleInputHandler.
    Author:
    Eva Gomes, Hugo Leal, Lucas Andrade

    • Method Detail

      • getAValidIntFromUser

        public static int getAValidIntFromUser(int min,
                                       int max,
                                       java.lang.String instruction)
                                throws InvalidArgumentException
        Returns a int chosen by the user, guaranteed to be between min and max.

        Asks the user for a number until the number inserted by the user is valid (meaning, is between min and max) and returns the valid number chosen.

        Parameters:
        min - The minimum value allowed.
        max - The maximum value allowed.
        instruction - The instructions to be printed to console before the user chooses a number.
        Returns:
        The number chosen by the user.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - If min>max.

      • askTheUserForAnInt

        public static int askTheUserForAnInt(int min,
                                     int max,
                                     java.lang.String instruction)
                              throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                     InvalidArgumentException
        Asks the user a for a int between min and max.
        Parameters:
        min - The minimum value allowed.
        max - The maximum value allowed.
        instruction - The instructions to be printed to console before the user chooses a number.
        Returns:
        The number inserted by the user, if it is between min and max; or 0, if the user inserted an invalid value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If the user inserted something that is not a number in the console.
        InvalidArgumentException - If the user inserted an invalid number in the console.

      • get_AFlightIDExistentInACertainDatabase_FromUser

        public static java.lang.String get_AFlightIDExistentInACertainDatabase_FromUser(Database flightsDB,
                                                                                java.lang.String instruction)
                                                                         throws DatabaseNotFoundException
        Returns a String chosen by the user, guaranteed to be the flightID of a flight stored in the database flightsDB.

        Asks the user for a flightID until the string inserted by the user is valid (meaning, is the flightID of a flight existent in the flightsDB) and returns the valid flightID chosen.

        If the user writes "ABORT" in the console, the message will be returned.

        Parameters:
        flightsDB - The database in which the flight with the flightID chosen must be stored.
        instruction - The instructions to be printed to console before the user chooses a flightID.
        Returns:
        The valid flightID of an airship stored in flightsDB chosen by the user; or "ABORT" if the user writes so in the console.
        Throws:
        DatabaseNotFoundException - When this method tries to reach a null or inexistent flights' database.

      • getAValidFlightIDFromUser

        public static java.lang.String getAValidFlightIDFromUser(java.lang.String instruction)
        Returns a String chosen by the user, guaranteed to be a valid flightID.

        Asks the user for a flightID until the string inserted by the user is a valid flightID and returns it. A valid flightID is a sequence of alphanumeric characters that can not be a null string nor an empty string ("") nor contain paragraph characters ("\n") nor contain characters that are not numbers nor letters (!"#$%.:,;- , the space character, etc).

        Parameters:
        instruction - The instructions to be printed to console before the user chooses a flightID.
        Returns:
        The flightID chosen by the user.

      • askTheUserForAFlightID

        public static java.lang.String askTheUserForAFlightID(java.lang.String instruction)
                                               throws InvalidFlightIDException
        Asks the user a for a String that is a flightID of a flight in flightsDB.
        Parameters:
        flightsDB - The database in which the flight with the flightID chosen must be stored.
        instruction - The instructions to be printed to console before the user chooses a flightID.
        Returns:
        The flightID inserted by the user, if it is a flightID ; or null, if the user inserted an invalid flightID.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the user inserted something that is not a flightID in the console; e.g. an empty string ("") or a string that contains paragraph characters ("\n") or space characters( " ").
        InvalidFlightIDException

      • isNotAnAlphanumericString

        public static boolean isNotAnAlphanumericString(java.lang.String str)
        Checks whether a string is not null, nor empty, nor contains the paragraph character ("\n") and is only constituted by alphanumeric characters.
        Parameters:
        str - The string to test.
        Returns:
        true if str is null or empty or contains the paragraph character or has at least one character that is not a letter nor a number; false if str has only numbers and letters.
